excerpt: Imposing hilltop fortress built in the 1600s with a complex tunnel system & offering audio tours.
detail_description: San Felipe de Barajas Fort, a hilltop fortress built in the 1600s, is a must-visit landmark in Cartagena. The fort offers audio tours and boasts a complex tunnel system for visitors to explore. Strategically positioned on San Lazaro hill, it provides an impressive view of the city and its surroundings. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is named after Philip IV of Spain and has gradually been constructed over 120 years.
name: San Felipe de Barajas Fort
address: Cielo mar, La Boquilla, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Hip Getsemani centers on Holy Trinity Square, where laid-back groups gather to drink beer, listen to street musicians and snack on grilled arepas from nearby stalls. Lively pizzerias and casual bistros serving Colombian staples line the surrounding streets, which are also known for their vivid murals. Brewpubs, cocktail bars and the amed salsa bar Cafe Havana, keep the party vibe going till the early hours.
detail_description: Getsemani is a vibrant neighborhood in Cartagena, Colombia, known for its lively atmosphere and local soul. The area is centered around Holy Trinity Square, where visitors can enjoy street musicians, grilled arepas, and a variety of dining options including pizzerias and casual bistros. Colorful murals adorn the surrounding streets, adding to the neighborhood's charm.
name: Getsemani
address: Cartagena, Cartagena Province, Bolivar, Colombia

excerpt: This convent on the city's highest hill dates to 1607 & offers a leafy cloister & sweeping views.
detail_description: Perched atop the highest hill in Cartagena, the Convent of Santa Cruz de la Popa is a 17th-century religious complex offering breathtaking views of the city and the Caribbean Sea. The monastery features a leafy cloister, a 21k gold-laden chapel, and a tranquil inner courtyard with a statue of the Virgin of Cadelaria. Despite enduring damage from attacks on Cartagena, the convent has been extensively restored over the years.
name: Convent of Santa Cruz de la Popa
address: Cl. 37, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Cartagena is a port city on Colombia’s Caribbean coast. By the sea is the walled Old Town, founded in the 16th century, with squares, cobblestone streets and colorful colonial buildings. With a tropical climate, the city is also a popular beach destination. Reachable by boat are Isla de Barú, with white-sand beaches and palm trees, and the Islas del Rosario, known for their coral reefs.
detail_description: Cartagena, a picturesque port city on Colombia's Caribbean coast, boasts a walled Old Town with charming cobblestone streets and vibrant colonial buildings dating back to the 16th century. This tropical destination is popular for its beautiful beaches and offers easy access to stunning islands like Isla de Barú and Islas del Rosario, known for their white-sand beaches, palm trees, and coral reefs. The city's rich history and Spanish Colonial architecture make it an alluring travel destination.
name: Cartagena
address: Cartagena Province, Bolivar, Colombia

excerpt: Vendors specialize in Bolivian & Cuban rice dishes, seafood & juices along this busy shopping strip.
detail_description: Mercado de Bazurto is a bustling food market in Cartagena that offers a real slice of local life. It's a vibrant and overwhelming experience, with vendors specializing in Bolivian and Cuban rice dishes, seafood, juices, and more. The market sells everything from fresh fruit to cooked turtle, showcasing a wide array of produce at very affordable prices.
name: Bazurto Market
address: Unnamed Road, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Bustling plaza featuring outdoor restaurants & bars, buskers, vendors & a sculpture by Botero.
detail_description: Plaza de Santo Domingo is a lively and bustling square in Cartagena, Colombia. The highlight of the plaza is the sculpture of La Gorda, a reclining nude bronze statue by Colombian sculptor Fernando Botero. This simple plaza is dominated by restaurants and often filled with street vendors selling artwork and souvenirs. Visitors can enjoy delicious cuisine at the fantastic restaurants while being entertained by street performers.
name: Plaza de Santo Domingo
address: Cl. 35, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Bocagrande is an upmarket area popular for its long, sandy beaches backed by palm-lined promenades. There are several casinos, along with an eclectic dining scene that includes beach snack bars, stylish Japanese and Colombian restaurants, global fast-food chains and mellow cafe terraces. Smart boutiques sell local and international fashion, while Plaza Bocagrande is an upscale mall with sea views.
detail_description: Bocagrande is a trendy area in Cartagena known for its expansive sandy beaches and vibrant atmosphere. The palm-lined promenades offer a variety of dining options, from beach snack bars to upscale Japanese and Colombian restaurants, as well as global fast-food chains. Visitors can explore smart boutiques selling local and international fashion, or visit Plaza Bocagrande, an upscale mall with sea views.
name: Bocagrande
address: Cartagena, Cartagena Province, Bolivar, Colombia

excerpt: Grand 16th-century church with a museum dedicated to its namesake, a canonized early abolitionist.
detail_description: Santuario de San Pedro Claver is a 16th-century church in Cartagena, dedicated to the Spanish Jesuit priest, San Pedro Claver. He was an early abolitionist who defended black people of African origin during the open slave trade in Cartagena and the Spanish Empire. The church also houses a museum dedicated to his legacy.
name: Santuario de San Pedro Claver
address: Plaza de San Pedro Claver, Cra. 4 #30-01, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Small urban square known for food sellers, plus colorful buildings & murals in surrounding streets.
detail_description: Plaza de la Trinidad is a vibrant urban square in the heart of Getsemani, known for its lively atmosphere and colorful surroundings. The area is filled with food vendors, colorful buildings, and striking murals that adorn the streets. Visitors can immerse themselves in the local culture by enjoying Champeta music, watching street performers dance for tips, and witnessing children playing around the church's staircases.
name: Plaza de la Trinidad
address: Esquina con, Cl. 29 #174, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: The cells of these former 18th-century dungeons now feature shops selling colorful souvenirs.
detail_description: Las Bóvedas, built in the late 18th century, was originally a munitions storehouse and later used as a dungeon during the Wars of Independence. The structure features 47 porticos and 23 domes and is located within the walls of Cartagena's Old City. Today, it houses artisan craft markets in its former cells, making it a popular tourist attraction.
name: Las Bóvedas
address: San Diego, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Dating to the 1800s, this monumental stone gateway in the city walls features a spired clocktower.
detail_description: The Monumento Torre del Reloj, a monumental stone gateway with a spired clocktower dating back to the 1800s, is an iconic landmark in Cartagena. It serves as the official entrance to the downtown area and opens out onto the lively marketplace of Plaza de los Coches. Nearby, visitors can explore other attractions such as Teatro Heredia, San Pedro Claver Church, Plaza de Bolivar, and Santa Domingo Church.
name: Monumento Torre del Reloj
address: Boca del Puente, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Popular watering hole for classic Cuban cocktails & live salsa music in festive, old-world digs.
detail_description: Café Havana is a lively spot in Cartagena known for its classic Cuban cocktails and live salsa music. The festive atmosphere and old-world charm make it a popular watering hole for locals and tourists alike. Located in the Getsemani neighborhood, this vibrant venue opens five nights a week until 4a.m., offering an authentic nightclub experience with energetic salsa music, a beautiful bar, and plenty of ceiling fans to keep patrons cool as they dance the night away.
name: Café Havana
address: Cra. 10 #ESQUINA, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Spacious plaza surrounded by colonial-era buildings, with a statue of Christopher Columbus.
detail_description: Plaza de la Aduana is a spacious square surrounded by colonial-era buildings and features a statue of Christopher Columbus. It is a popular spot for live music and dancing, offering a vibrant atmosphere to experience the local culture. Nearby, Plaza de Santo Domingo also provides lively entertainment, while Plaza de San Pedro Claver showcases a church dedicated to the Catalan missionary who worked to protect and assist black slaves.
name: Plaza de la Aduana
address: Cl. 32 #130, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: This museum focuses on pre-Columbian relics, with 600+ gold, silver & ceramic pieces on display.
detail_description: The Museo del Oro Zenú, part of the Central Bank and established in 1982, showcases over 600 pre-Columbian artifacts including gold, silver, and ceramic pieces. The museum offers a glimpse into the history of Colombia's indigenous Zenu people through its exhibits. Visitors can explore various time periods such as the Middle Ages and admire traditional attire and handicrafts.
name: Museo del Oro Zenú
address: Parque o Plaza, Cra 4, de Bolívar #33-26, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Delicias del mar, located on the historic walls of Cartagena's western tip at Baluarte Santo Domingo, is a popular spot for locals and tourists alike to enjoy breathtaking sunset views over the Caribbean. The 17th-century fortifications provide an atmospheric backdrop as visitors savor delicious seafood and cocktails while being entertained by live music. The bar's relaxed party vibe and international crowd make it a must-visit destination for those seeking an unforgettable sunset experience in Cartagena.
name: Delicias Del Mar
address: Zona de Comidas, CC Paseo de la Castellana, Local 226, El Rubí, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Walled City Walkers offers an immersive and informative walking tour experience through the historic walled cities of various destinations. The tours are led by knowledgeable guides who share fascinating stories about the history, culture, and architecture of these ancient cities. Participants can explore hidden gems, picturesque streets, and iconic landmarks while learning about the rich heritage of the walled cities.
name: Walled City Walkers
address: Urb. Bulevard la Cast, B2-302, Villa Sandra, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Iconic public square surrounded by a historic cathedral, museum & government buildings.
detail_description: Plaza de Bolívar is a historic public square in Cartagena, surrounded by significant landmarks such as the 16th-century cathedral, the Palace of Inquisition, and the Zenu Gold Museum. The area also features attractions like Teatro Heredia, Puerta del Reloj, San Pedro Claver Church, and Santa Domingo Church with its sculpture Mujer Reclinada by Fernando Botero.
name: Plaza de Bolívar
address: Cra. 5 #33-15, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Island off the coast of Cartagena that features several towns & the ruins of a historic fort.
detail_description: Tierra Bomba Island, located off the coast of Cartagena, is a quick 10-minute boat ride from Bocagrande Peninsula. The island offers less crowded beaches than those on the mainland, with Punta Arena providing stretches of shoreline and impressive views of the Cartagena skyline. Visitors can catch a boat from Castillogrande or opt for a day pass at a beach club for access to private, cleaner beaches.
name: Tierra Bomba Island
address: Cartagena Province, Bolivar, Colombia

excerpt: Lively, historic plaza with confectioners' stalls, carriage rides & a statue of Cartagena's founder.
detail_description: Plaza de los Coches, located just inside the entrance to Cartagena's Old Town under the iconic clock tower, is a vibrant and historic square. Once a site for slave trading, it now bustles with activity as locals and tourists gather to start their city explorations or enjoy carriage rides. The plaza is lined with vendors offering an array of goods, from souvenirs to Colombian sweets.
name: Plaza de los Coches
address: Cra. 7, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Cartagena, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Plaza de Bolívar, also known as Plaza Bolívar, is a charming public square located in the heart of Cartagena's historic old town. It features a statue of Bolivar surrounded by devoted pigeons and shaded park benches, making it an ideal spot to relax or enjoy a street coffee. The plaza offers respite from the city's heat and is dotted with fruit stands where locals sell refreshing watermelon and tropical fruits.
name: Plaza de Bolívar
address: El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Plaza de Mercado Bazurto is a vibrant hub that immerses you in the heart of local Colombian culture. This bustling market showcases the authentic lifestyle of Cartagena, offering an array of fresh produce, seafood, and traditional dishes. As you wander through its lively passages, you'll encounter friendly vendors eager to share their culinary delights. While it may not meet Western standards of cleanliness or presentation—gloves are often absent when food is served—the experience is undeniably genuine and rich with flavor.
name: Plaza de Mercado Bazurto
address: Cl. 29c Bis #29, Chino, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Café del Mural is a charming coffee spot nestled in the Getsemani neighborhood. It offers a wide variety of delicious coffee options and delectable baked goods, including unique treats like Colombian affogato with homemade ice cream. The cafe also hosts coffee roasting workshops for enthusiasts interested in learning the traditional Colombian method. The owner, David, is passionate and knowledgeable about coffee and offers an array of preparation methods, from modern techniques to traditional espresso.
name: Café del Mural
address: Cl. de San Juan # 25-60, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Museum with exhibits on the Colombian Navy, plus the history & culture of the region.
detail_description: Museo Naval del Caribe is a must-visit museum in Cartagena that offers an immersive experience into the naval history of Colombia and the Caribbean region. Opened in 1992 to commemorate Columbus' arrival in the Americas, this museum showcases a diverse range of exhibits, including models of ships, Colombian cities, old boats, marine antiques, galleries on pearl extraction, and ancient fishing tools.
name: Museo Naval del Caribe
address: Cl. 31 #3-26, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Intimate restaurant offering traditional dishes, including seafood meals & snacks.
detail_description: Restaurante Celele is a cozy dining spot that fulfills the culinary vision of Colombian chefs Jaime Rodriguez and Sebastian Pinzon. Located in a historic building with rustic charm in Cartagena's Getsemani neighborhood, this restaurant offers an intimate setting for savoring traditional dishes, particularly seafood specialties and snacks.
name: Celele.
address: Calle del Espíritu Santo, Cra. 10c #29-200, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Defensive stone walls snaking 11km around Cartagena, dating to the 1600s & known for sunset vistas.
detail_description: The Walls of Cartagena are defensive stone walls that stretch 11km around the city, dating back to the 1600s. They are renowned for offering stunning sunset vistas. In the past, Getsemani, once known as a neighborhood with a seedy reputation, has transformed into Cartagena's hippest area. It now boasts an edgy and artistic atmosphere, best exemplified by its own city walls which serve as an amazing art gallery.
name: Walls of Cartagena
address: Cl. de la Serrezuela, San Diego, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Café San Alberto in Plaza Santo Domingo, Cartagena is a renowned coffee temple that offers an extraordinary coffee experience. Their award-winning beans from Buenavista, Quindio are meticulously brewed using various methods including molecular cupping. The "Coffee Baptism" program takes visitors on a captivating journey of coffee exploration. The café's knowledgeable baristas and intricate brewing apparatus ensure a unique and unforgettable sensory experience.
name: Café San Alberto Cartagena - Plaza Santo Domingo
address: Plaza Santo Domingo, Cra. 3 #35-18, Centro Historico, Cartagena de Indias, Centro Histórico, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Bright rooms, some with terraces, in a laid-back hotel offering free Wi-Fi & a hot tub.
detail_description: OLD TOWN HOUSE is a laid-back hotel with bright rooms, some featuring terraces and free Wi-Fi. The historic district within the walled city boasts colonial buildings, churches, and plazas like Plaza Bolivar, where visitors can enjoy traditional Colombian music performances. Families often spend time in the Old Town and Getsemani for their colorful street art. Boca Grande is known for its high-rise hotels along the beachfront and casinos.
name: OLD TOWN HOUSE
address: Centro Amurallado, Calle del Jardin No 39-65 Barrio, San Diego, Cartagena de Indias, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: 1974 statue honoring the legendary India Catalina, an indigenous woman who was a Spanish translator.
detail_description: The Monumento India Catalina is a 1974 statue in Cartagena, Colombia, honoring the legendary India Catalina, an indigenous woman who was kidnapped by Spanish forces as a child and later became a key translator for conquistador Pedro de Heredia. The monument is located on the edge of Centro near a bridge crossing to the rest of the city.
name: Monumento India Catalina
address: Av. Venezuela, La Matuna, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Rafael Núñez International Airport, located just 15 minutes outside the center of Cartagena, Colombia, is a major hub with direct flights to and from cities like Miami, Fort Lauderdale, and New York. It's a relatively small airport with 8 national gates and 7 international gates. Despite its size, it offers essential amenities and a secure environment. Travelers can easily reach the city center from the airport by taking a taxi, public bus or renting a car.
name: Rafael Núñez International Airport
address: Crespo Calle 70, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Understated restaurant specializing in traditional seafood dishes including rice, pasta & soups.
detail_description: La Cevichería is a cozy seafood eatery in Cartagena that gained fame after being featured on Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations TV series. It is known for its traditional seafood dishes, including rice, pasta, and soups. The restaurant is always busy with both tourists and locals, so it's recommended to arrive early as they don't usually take reservations.
name: La Cevichería
address: Calle Stuart por el hotel Santa Clara Calle 39 #7 14, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Donde Fidel Salsa Bar is a legendary establishment in Cartagena's nightlife scene, boasting a three-decade history of serving up classic salsa beats behind the city's historic walls. Situated near the iconic Clock Tower, this open-air bar owned by Fidel Leottau offers an ideal setting for street theater and people-watching while enjoying reasonably priced cold beers or rum.
name: Donde Fidel Salsa Bar
address: Portal de los Dulces, Cra. 4, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Cerro La Popa is a 148-meter hill featuring a convent and the Church of the Virgin of La Candelaria, dating back to the late 16th century. However, its main attraction lies in offering panoramic views of the city. Visitors can witness stark socioeconomic contrasts from this vantage point, observing both luxurious sectors and impoverished areas. The hill provides an excellent vantage point to capture stunning photos encompassing the sea, cityscape, and lush greenery.
name: Cerro La Popa
address: Cartagena, Cartagena Province, Bolivar, Colombia

detail_description: Mirador Gastro Bar is a rooftop bar located on the fourth floor of Hotel Torre del Reloj, offering stunning views of the Clock Tower and the Convention Center in Cartagena de Indias. It opens at 8 am, making it perfect for breakfast, lunch, afternoon cocktails, and sunset gazing over Plaza de los Coches. The bar features Latin music and videos on large screens, creating a lively atmosphere.
name: Mirador Gastro Bar
address: Cra. 7 #32-77, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: The Portal de Los Dulces is a candy store in Cartagena that is dedicated to traditional Colombian sweets. The store has a variety of sweet treats, including coconut candy, fruity local sweets, and much more. The store is open from March until the end of October.
name: Portal de los dulces
address: Cra. 7, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Media Luna Hostel in Cartagena is a popular choice for solo travelers and groups looking for shared or single rooms. The hostel offers a vibrant atmosphere with its Mega Party night on Wednesdays, making it the go-to place for those seeking an exciting nightlife experience. While not considered luxurious, it's perfect for travelers who prioritize round-the-clock partying over accommodation quality. The hostel's central location allows guests to explore the neighborhood and interact with friendly locals without language barriers.
name: Media Luna Hostel - Cartagena
address: 10-46 Media Luna 10, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Residence-turned-museum dedicated to former resident & multiple-time Colombian president.
detail_description: Casa Museo Rafael Núñez is a well-preserved museum located in the El Cabrero neighborhood near the sea. It was once the residence of Rafael Núñez, a significant figure in Colombian history who served as president multiple times and authored the national anthem. The two-story wooden house exudes simplicity and elegance, reflecting Núñez's lifestyle.
name: Casa Museo Rafael Núñez
address: Cra. 2 #41-89, Barrio El Cabrero, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Cocteleria Clock Tower, also known as Torre del Reloj, is a significant landmark in Cartagena and serves as the main gateway to the inner walled Old Town. It's a popular meeting spot for locals and visitors alike. Plaza de La Paz, located in front of the monument, offers a vibrant atmosphere with street artists performing traditional Colombian coastal music and dance. The tower's reconstruction in the 19th century gave it its iconic yellow facade and clock.
name: Cocteleria Clock Tower
address: Cra. 82 #3330, Las Américas, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: When visiting Cartagena, a must-see attraction is the Caribe Jewelry and Emerald Museum in the Old City. This museum offers an intriguing look into the history and allure of emeralds, showcasing the mining and cutting processes as well as exquisite jewelry pieces. Visitors can witness skilled artisans extracting emeralds from rocks to create stunning jewelry on-site. The knowledgeable staff, including the three brothers who own the museum and shop, also operate a mine and provide valuable insights into this precious gemstone.
name: Caribe Jewelry and Emerald Museum (Old City)
address: Cra. 4 #33-20, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Plaza de San Diego is a picturesque square nestled in the heart of Cartagena's walled city. The charming colonial-style buildings painted in soft hues create a delightful ambiance, making it a favorite hangout for both locals and visitors. You can relax at one of the cafes dotting the square, sipping on coffee or enjoying a refreshing drink while observing the bustling activity around you. The plaza also offers an opportunity to browse through vendors selling jewelry, souvenirs, and handcrafted items.
name: Plaza de San Diego
address: Cl. 39 #809, San Diego, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Edificio Parque Centenario is a well-located apartment building in Getsemani, offering an excellent location right across from the Centenario Park, which acts as a divider from the walled city. The area boasts numerous attractions and is a lovely place to stay for those looking to explore the surroundings.
name: Edificio Parque Centenario
address: Media Luna 8B #8B-108, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Barrio Walled City in Cartagena is the perfect place to immerse yourself in the city's historical charm. It's the center of all the action and boasts grand architecture, making it a hub for tourism. While accommodations tend to be on the expensive luxury side, staying within the walled city ensures an unforgettable experience surrounded by rich history and vibrant energy.
name: Barrio Walled City
address: Cra. 6 & Cl. 35, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Royal Center Historical is a must-visit district in Cartagena that offers a glimpse into the colonial era. It's known as a stronghold of the upper middle class and features colorful streets and vibrant squares adorned with bougainvillea. Taking a leisurely stroll through this neighborhood allows visitors to immerse themselves in its rich history and experience the beauty of Cartagena at night.
name: Royal Center Historical
address: Cra. 9a #321-3271, La Matuna, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Muelle De Los Pegasos, situated in the vibrant Getsemani neighborhood alongside Centennial Park and the Clock Tower, offers a stunning view. Its name is derived from the two striking horse or pegasus sculptures near the convention center.
name: Muelle De Los Pegasos
address: El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Cultural complex with elegant architecture showcasing historical items & educational exhibits.
detail_description: The Museum of Cartagena de Indias is a cultural complex known for its elegant architecture and historical exhibits. It's considered one of the best museums in Cartagena, offering a journey through the country's history with educational displays. Visitors can explore traditional attire, medieval artifacts, and impressive art pieces. Additionally, the Palacio de la Inquisicion provides an eerie experience for those interested in history and human nature's darker side.
name: Museum of Cartagena de Indias
address: 46, Plaza de Bolivar Carrera 3 33, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: This Spanish-style Catholic basilica built during the 16th & 17th centuries is a national monument.
detail_description: The Catedral de Santa Catalina de Alejandría is a stunning Spanish-style Catholic basilica located in the heart of Cartagena, Colombia. This national monument, built during the 16th and 17th centuries, stands out with its vibrant lemon-yellow exterior and white trim. The bell tower and dome are prominent features that dominate the city's skyline. As the episcopal see of the Archbishop of Cartagena de Indias, it holds great historical and religious significance.
name: Catedral de Santa Catalina de Alejandría
address: Calle de los Santos de Piedra, Cra. 4, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Hip bar with a rooftop terrace serving inventive cocktails, sandwiches, seafood & meat plates.
detail_description: Alquimico is a vibrant rooftop bar located at Cl. del Colegio # 34-24, offering an art deco-themed experience across three floors. It stands out as the only rooftop bar not affiliated with a hotel and has gained acclaim from travelers for its artisanal and alchemical experiences. The bar opens from 7 pm until the early hours, providing one of the best party atmospheres in the city.
name: Alquimico
address: Cl. del Colegio #34-24, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Bright Australian-influenced cafe offering breakfast & brunch, healthy bowls, sandwiches & coffee.
detail_description: Cafe Stepping Stone in Cartagena, Colombia is a vibrant Australian-influenced cafe located in the colorful Getsemani neighborhood. The menu features a variety of options including breakfast, brunch, healthy bowls, sandwiches, and coffee. While not strictly vegetarian, there are many vegetarian and vegan choices available. The cafe also offers Colombian options such as platanitos and pila de arepa.
name: Cafe Stepping Stone CARTAGENA, COLOMBIA
address: #30-40 a, Carrera 10 #30102, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: El Barón is a must-visit spot in Cartagena known for its carefully crafted and innovative mixology. It exudes a professional yet captivating vibe that complements the majestic San Pedro Claver square where it's located. The cocktail menu includes unique creations like 'Ven a mi' and 'Penicillin,' alongside classic drinks.
name: El Barón
address: Carrera 4, Cl. San Pedro Claver #31-7, Cartagena de Indias, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: ALMA Restaurante - Bar is a must-visit in Cartagena, known for its elegant atmosphere and impeccable service. The restaurant is set against the backdrop of a centuries-old aqueduct, offering guests the choice to dine in a colonial courtyard or one of the indoor salons adorned with decor inspired by Colombia's Caribbean coast.
name: ALMA Restaurante - Bar
address: Cl. 36, centro historico, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Libertario Coffee Roasters in Cartagena is a popular spot known for serving some of the best coffee in the city, and possibly even the world. Located on Calle Media Luna in Getsemani, this light-filled cafe offers a delightful atmosphere to enjoy their top-notch coffee and healthy breakfast options. The team of baristas and kitchen crew adds to the special charm of this place.
name: Libertario Coffee Roasters Cartagena
address: Cra. 10 #30-14, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia
